definition: to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)

sentences.english: After going only a mile or so, they realized they had forgotten the milking stools.
sentences.chinese: 走了大約一英里，他們發現擠奶用的凳子忘記拿了。

sentences.english: He can learn when each cow was milked and how much she produced.
sentences.chinese: 他能夠知道每頭奶牛何時擠奶，擠了多少奶。

sentences.english: The ants milk their herds by stroking them with their antennae.
sentences.chinese: 螞蟻用他們的觸角給他們的牧羣“擠奶”。

sentences.english: A milkmaid was going to the market. She carried her milk in a pail on her head.
sentences.chinese: 一個擠奶的女孩打算去市場，她用腦袋頂着一桶奶。

sentences.english: This mistress of the milking-pail stared, but, making no answer to this round declaration.
sentences.chinese: 這位擠奶夫人瞪了一眼，可對這直率的宣言不置一詞。

sentences.english: The cows will be in for milking soon.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛一會兒就趕回來等待擠奶。

sentences.english: So infected animals should be milked separately from uninfected ones.
sentences.chinese: 所以感染了的動物應該與未感染的分開擠奶。

sentences.english: It is important for studying this kind of milking machine.
sentences.chinese: 這對該類擠奶機的進一步深入研究具有重要作用。

sentences.english: A new controller with full functions was developed.
sentences.chinese: 研製出控制功能齊全的擠奶機自動清洗控制器。

sentences.english: Milkers should always wash their hands.
The animals are milked everyday in good weather or bad.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛不分天氣好壞每天都要擠奶。

sentences.english: Teat injuriescanalso called mass titerscause mastitis, so be careful during milking.
sentences.chinese: 奶頭的傷痕會導致乳腺炎，所以在擠奶的時候要小心。

sentences.english: Selecting the equipments reasonably is the key to building the mechanization milking station.
sentences.chinese: 合理地選擇設備是機械化擠奶站建設項目的關鍵步驟。

sentences.english: The ants keep sucking at them to obtain their honeydew - milking, you might call it.
sentences.chinese: 它們正在吮吸蚜蟲身上的蜜汁，也可以說他們在擠奶。

sentences.english: Their udders were frequently ulcerated , but they would be milked regardless.
sentences.chinese: 它們的乳腺經常潰爛，但照樣擠奶。

definition: to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
the breeding season (zool.)/oestrus (period of sexual receptivity of female mammals)
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
